main event: An electronics engineer in Great Neck, New York observed a silvery-white, disc-shaped object traveling at high speed and without any noise on November 6, 1957.
interesting points: The object was described as being about three times the size of a helicopter.
The object had two red lights and one white light.
The object was observed moving back and forth across the sky, with a tail that looked like a red line.
The object made a high-pitch whistling sound.
The observer estimated the object was flying at an altitude of around 10,200 feet and at a speed of approximately 25 mph.
photographs: no photographs included in the report
